{"step_by_step_thinking": "The key to this question is the size of the swelling and its response to salicylates. Osteoma and osteoblastoma are typically larger than 2 cm. Osteochondroma is usually painless. Osteoid osteoma, on the other hand, is typically less than 2 cm and is known to cause pain that responds well to salicylates.", "answer_choice": "C. Osteoid osteoma"}
